name: Data on access to water
source: World Health Organization and United Nations Children's Fund, Joint Measurement Programme (JMP)
definition: Existence of data on access to water, according to international standards. Access to an improved water source is currently defined as the percentage of the population that can obtain at least 20 liters per person per day from an improved source that is within one kilometer of the users dwelling. Improved water sources include household connection, public standpipe, borehole, protected well or spring, and rainwater collection, but do not include water provided through vendors, tanker trucks, unprotected wells, unprotected springs, and bottled water. Unsafe water and lack of basic sanitation is the direct cause of many water-related diseases in developing countries. This indicator monitors access to improved water sources based on the assumption that improved sources are likely to provide safer water and relates to the seventh MDG to ensure environmental sustainability.
short_def: Access to an improved water source is currently defined as the percentage of the population that can obtain at least 20 liters per person per day from an improved source that is within one kilometer of the users dwelling. Improved water sources include household connection, public standpipe, borehole, protected well or spring, and rainwater collection, but do not include water provided through vendors, tanker trucks, unprotected wells, unprotected springs, and bottled water.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if primary estimates are observed for at least 2 and 1 out of the 6 latest years, respectively.

name: Accessible microdata
definition: Accessibility of micro data sets online.

name: NSO outreach to users
definition: This indicator measures whether the NSO has an active outreach to users. Active outreach is defined as one of the following strategies: press conferences: workshops for users of statistics publications and booklets tailored for specific groups special web sections for different types of users (e.g. academia, media) seminars  including e-learning, live chat sessions and podcasts.
short_def: This indicator measures whether the NSO has an active outreach to users.
methodo: Scores is 1 if the country has an active outreach to users.

name: Advocacy material
definition: Existence of booklet or material used by  country for advocacy for statistics at national level

name: Agricultural census
definition: Existence of an agricultural census, according to international standards. Agricultural censuses collect information on agricultural activities, such as agricultural land use, employment and production, and provide basic structural data and sampling frames for agricultural surveys. It is recommended that agricultural censuses be conducted at least every 10 years.
short_def: Agricultural censuses collect information on agricultural activities, such as agricultural land use, employment and production, and provide basic structural data and sampling frames for agricultural surveys.
methodo: Score is equal to 1 if the country had a census at least in the last 10 years.

name: Available microdata
definition: Availability of microdata datasets.

name: Balance of payments manual in use
source: IMF: Balance of Payment Statistics yearbook (BPS)
definition: Adoption of one of the two latest editions (BPM5 or BPM6) of balance of payments manuals, according to international standards. The Balance of Payments Manual serves as an international standard for the compilation of balance of payments statistics. The manual has evolved to meet changing economic and financial environment and analytic requirements. The first edition was published in 1948 and successive editions in 1950, 1961, 1977, 1993, and 2013.
short_def: The Balance of Payments Manual serves as an international standard for the compilation of balance of payments statistics.
methodo: Score is 1 for countries adopting one of the two latest editions (BPM5 or BPM6).

name: Birth data from vital registration
definition: Whether the country has birth data from vital registration.

name: Data on child immunization
definition: Existence of data on child immunization, according to international standards. The proportion of one-year-old children immunized against measles is the proportion of children aged one who received one dose of measles vaccine. A child is considered adequately immunized against measles after receiving one dose of vaccine. Immunization is an essential component for reducing under-five mortality, and it serves as a proxy to measure the coverage and the quality of the child health care system. This indicator is also related to the fourth MDG aiming at reducing child mortality.
short_def: The proportion of one-year-old children immunized against measles is the proportion of children aged one who received one dose of measles vaccine. A child is considered adequately immunized against measles after receiving one dose of vaccine.
methodo: Score is 1 if the periodicity of the indicator is annual within 5 year reference period. For assessment, look at 5 year interval starting 2 years before current year and count number of data points available.

name: Data on child malnutrition
source: World Health Organization (WHO) , Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition
definition: Existence of data on child malnutrition, according to international standards. Prevalence of underweight children under-five years of age, also known as prevalence of child malnutrition (weight for age), is the percentage of children under-five whose weight for age is less than minus two standard deviations from the median for the international reference population ages 0 to 59 months. The data are based on the World Health Organizations new child growth standards released in 2006. Child malnutrition is linked to poverty, low levels of education, and poor access to health services. Sufficient and good-quality nutrition is therefore critical for development, health, and survival of current and succeeding generations. This indicator monitors nutritional status and health in populations and relates to the first MDG aiming at reducing poverty and hunger.
short_def: Prevalence of underweight children under-five years of age, also known as prevalence of child malnutrition (weight for age), is the percentage of children under-five whose weight for age is less than minus two standard deviations from the median for the international reference population ages 0 to 59 months.
methodo: Scores are 1, 2/3 and 1/3 if the indicator was observed at least 3 times, 2 times or once within 10 years.

name: Data on child mortality
source: UNICEF, WHO, World Bank, UN DESA, UNDP
definition: Existence of data on child mortality, according to international standards. Under-five mortality rate is the probability that a newborn baby will die before reaching age five, if subject to current age-specific mortality rates. The probability is expressed as a rate per 1,000. The indicator measures child survival. Survival of a child is closely linked to the provision of primary health-care services but poverty, malnutrition, a decline in breast-feeding, maternal education, use of improved water, and inadequacy sanitation and health facilities are all associated with high child mortality. The indicator relates to the fourth MDG calling for reducing child mortality.
short_def: Under-five mortality rate is the probability that a newborn baby will die before reaching age five, if subject to current age-specific mortality rates. The probability is expressed as a rate per 1,000. The indicator measures child survival.
methodo: Score is 1 if a national or international estimate is available for reference year. For assessment the reference year which is the year 2 years before current will be checked for data availability.

name: Civil registration and vital statistics
definition: Existence of civil registration and vital statistics in the country.

name: Civil society organizations active in statistics
definition: This indicator captures whether civil society organisations are active in statistics of the country. Active organisations are considered those as registered in the data base of the NGO branch of UNDESA.
short_def: This indicator measures whether civil society organisations are active in statistics of the country.
methodo: Quantity of CSOs in the country. Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Commitments to statistics
note: drop this version of the statistic? was taken from the metabase
definition: Financial support to development in statistics received by the country.

name: Use of consumer price index base year
source: IMF: International Financial Statistics (IFS) - Country notes
definition: Usage of CPI, according to international standards. Consumer Price Index (CPI) serves as indicators of inflation and reflects changes in the cost of acquiring a fixed basket of goods and services by the average consumer. Weights are usually derived from consumer expenditure surveys and the CPI base year refers to the year the weights were derived.
short_def: The CPI is a statistical estimate constructed using the prices of a sample of representative items whose prices are collected periodically. The annual percentage change in a CPI is used as a measure of inflation.
methodo: Score is 1 if the base year is within the last 10 years. For assessment it is being looked 10 years back starting the year before current.

name: Control of corruption

definition: World Bank Governance Indicator on Corruption. Control of corruption captures perceptions of the extent to which public power is exercised for private gain, including both petty and grand forms of corruption, as well as \capture\" of the state by elites and private interests."
short_def: Control of Corruption captures perceptions of the extent to which public power is exercised for private gain, including both petty and grand forms of corruption, as well as \capture\" of the state by elites and private interests. "
methodo: Estimate gives the country's score on the aggregate indicator, in units of a standard normal distribution, i.e. ranging from approximately -2.5 to 2.5.
methodo_link: Statistical Methodology available in Kaufmann, Daniel, Aart Kraay and Massimo Mastruzzi (2010). \The Worldwide Governance Indicators: Methodology and Analytical Issues\". World Bank Policy Research Working Paper No. 5430 (http://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=1682130). "

name: NSO data dissemination policy
definition: This indicator assesses whether there exist microdata access policies. Confidentiality protection for microdata has become a very popular topic at the international level after the diffusion over the internet of data dissemination.__NSOs give limited access to countries microdata_for confidentiality protection. Measures of access policies  based on the UNECE Report on Managing Statistical Confidentiality & Microdata Access should cover:_i) what can and cannot be done and for what purposes with the data ii) the conditions of release iii) the consequences if these conditions are breached.__
short_def: This indicator assesses_whether_there exist microdata access policies._
methodo: Score is 1 if the NSO has microdata access policies.

definition: Statistical legislation details, link to statistical law, compliance with the UN principles, etc.

name: Details on NSO organization
definition: The National Statistical Office (NSO) webpage provides detailed information on the organigram of the NSO if it reports on its organisational structure and the roles of its staff.
short_def: This indicator measures whether the NSO webpage provides detailed information on the organisational structure of the NSO (organigram).
methodo: Score is 1 if the NSO webpage provides detailed organisational information.

name: National sectoral statistical strategy
definition: Existence of sectoral strategy for agriculture, education and other sectors, including in consultation with colleagues and online

name: External debt reporting
source: International Debt Statistics (for low- and middle-income countries)
definition: Existence of data on external debt, according to international standards. The principal sources of external debt statistics are reports submitted to the World Bank through its Debtor Reporting System by reporting countries. Data quality and coverage vary among countries and from year to year. The reporting status shows, for the latest series, whether data were used as reported (actual), data were preliminary and included an element of staff estimation (preliminary), or data are staff estimates (estimate).
short_def: The principal sources of external debt statistics are reports submitted to the World Bank through its Debtor Reporting System by reporting countries. Data quality and coverage vary among countries and from year to year. The reporting status shows, for the latest series, whether data were used as reported (actual), data were preliminary and included an element of staff estimation (preliminary), or data are staff estimates (estimate).
methodo: Score is 1 for actual or preliminary reporting status, rather than existence of data on external debt.

name: Facebook
note: redundant with social media presence variable
definition: The NSO uses facebook to disseminate data and information

name: Fragile state
source: World Bank Groups (WBG) Fragile, Conflict and Violence Group
definition: This indicator measures whether a country is on the World Bank's Harmonized List of Fragile Situations. Fragile Situations include countries or territories with (i) a harmonized CPIA country rating of 3.2 or less, and/or (ii) the presence of a UN and/or regional peace-keeping or political/peace-building mission during the last three years.
short_def: This indicator measures whether a country is on the World Bank's Harmonized List of Fragile Situations.
dissem_agency: World Bank Groups (WBG) Fragile, Conflict and Violence Group
methodo: Score is 1 if country is on the World Bank's Harmonized List of Fragile Situations.

name: eGDDS subscription
family: Quality assurance and codes of conduct
definition: This indicator captures whether countries subscribe to enhanced General Data Dissemination System (e-GDDS). The e-GDDS replaced the GDDS in 2015 and is designed to assist participants in improving data transparency and governance by publishing essential data for the analysis of macroeconomic conditions. It provides a framework for developing a clear roadmap to achieving higher data dissemination standards at a pace consistent with evolving statistical capacity. It focuses on publication of the data through a standardized platform to improve efficiency in data sharing, while identifying critical gaps to help prioritize technical assistance and donor support. Many countries are using participation in the e-GDDS as a step towards subscription to the SDDS.
short_def: This indicator captures whether countries subscribe to enhanced General Data Dissemination System (e-GDDS).
methodo: Score is 1 if country is subscribed to enhanced General Data Dissemination System (e-GDDS)

name: GDDS/SDDS
family: Quality assurance and codes of conduct
note: redundant with separate GDDS and SDDS variables
definition: Subscription to IMF SDDS/GDDS

name: GDP base year
definition: The baseline year of the gross domestic product indicator.

name: GDP per capita
source: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.
definition: GDP per capita is gross domestic product divided by midyear population. GDP is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in constant 2010 U.S. dollars.
short_def: GDP per capita is gross domestic product divided by midyear population.
methodo: Weighted average. For more information, see the World Bank metadata for constant U.S. dollar GDP and total population.  Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Data on gender equality in education
source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics: Table 5: Enrolment ratios by ISCED level
definition: Existence of data on gender equality in education, according to international standards. The indicator is defined as the ratio of the gross enrollment rate of girls to boys in primary and secondary education levels in both public and private schools. Women have an enormous impact on the well-being of their families and societies, but their potential is sometimes not realized because of discriminatory social norms, incentives, and legal institutions. Although their status has improved in recent decades, gender inequalities persist. Education is one of the most important aspects of human development, and eliminating gender disparity at all levels of education would help to increase the status and capabilities of women. This indicator provides a measure of equality of educational opportunity and relates to the third MDG that seeks to promote gender equality and the empowerment of women.
short_def: This indicator is defined as the ratio of the gross enrollment rate of girls to boys in primary and secondary education levels in both public and private schools.
methodo: Scores are 1, 2/3 and 1/3 if the indicator is observed for 5, 4-3 and 2-1 out of the 5 latest years, respectively.

name: Government effectiveness
source: WGI are produced by Daniel Kaufmann (Natural Resource Governance Institute and Brookings Institution) and Aart Kraay (World Bank Development Research Group).
definition: Government effectiveness captures perceptions of the quality of public services, the quality of the civil service and the degree of its independence from political pressures, the quality of policy formulation and implementation, and the credibility of the government's commitment to such policies.
short_def: Government Effectiveness captures perceptions of the quality of public services, the quality of the civil service and the degree of its independence from political pressures, the quality of policy formulation and implementation, and the credibility of the government's commitment to such policies.
methodo: Estimate gives the country's score on the aggregate indicator, in units of a standard normal distribution, i.e. ranging from approximately -2.5 to 2.5.
methodo_link: Statistical Methodology available in Kaufmann, Daniel, Aart Kraay and Massimo Mastruzzi (2010). \The Worldwide Governance Indicators: Methodology and Analytical Issues\". World Bank Policy Research Working Paper No. 5430 (http://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=1682130). "

name: Government finance accounting concept
definition: Quality of government finance accounting, according to international standards. Government finance accounting concept describes the accounting basis for reporting central government financial data. For many countries government finance data have been consolidated into one set of accounts capturing all the central government's fiscal activities. Budgetary central government accounts do not necessarily include all central government units, the picture they provide of central government activities is usually incomplete.
short_def: Government finance accounting concept describes the accounting basis for reporting central government financial data.
methodo: Score is 1 for consolidated account.

name: Government statistical capacity
definition: This indicator assesses for African countries the capacity of statistical systems using a diagnostic framework which consists of three assessment areas: statistical methodology: source data: and periodicity and timeliness. It assesses the extent to which the Office of National Statistics produces detailed and timely data on employment and poverty. This includes whether data are available and disaggregated by sex, geographic region, age, and economic activity, whether recent surveys are available online for free or can be obtained on paper within less than two weeks at the cost of photocopying. It also assesses if the independence of the Office of National Statistics is guaranteed. It consists of two sub-indicators.
short_def: This indicator assesses for African countries the capacity of statistical systems using a diagnostic framework which consists of three assessment areas: statistical methodology: source data: and periodicity and timeliness.
methodo: Scores are normalized into a scale of 0.0-100.0, whereby 100.0 is the best score. A countrys change in score and rank may be reflective of other countries performing better or worse.  Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Health surveys
definition: Existence of health surveys, according to international standards. Health surveys collect information on various aspects of health of populations, such as health expenditure, access, utilization, and outcomes. They typically include Demographic and Health Surveys, Core Welfare Indicator Questionnaire surveys, Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey, Integrated Surveys, Living Standard Measuring Surveys, Priority Surveys and other health related surveys. It is recommended that health surveys be conducted at least every 3 to 5 years.
short_def: Health surveys collect information on various aspects of health of populations, such as health expenditure, access, utilization, and outcomes.
methodo: Scores are 1, 2/3 and 1/3 if the indicator was observed at least 3 times, 2 times, or once within 10 years.

name: HIV/AIDS
definition: Existence of data on HIV/AIDS prevalence, according to international standards. HIV prevalence at any given age is the difference between the cumulative numbers of people who have become affected with HIV up to this age and the number who died, expressed as a percentage of the total number alive at this age. The basis of measuring infection is the incidence of HIV among people aged 15-49. HIV/AIDS is one of the worlds most important killers and has its greatest impact on poor countries and poor people. This indicator relates to MDG number six to combat HIV/AIDS, malaria, and other diseases.
short_def: HIV prevalence at any given age is the difference between the cumulative numbers of people who have become affected with HIV up to this age and the number who died, expressed as a percentage of the total number alive at this age. The basis of measuring infection is the incidence of HIV among people aged 15-49.
methodo: Score is 1 if at least one national or international estimate is available in the last 3 years.

name: IDA eligibility
source: International Development Association World Bank Group
definition: This indicator measures whether the country is eligilbe for borrowing from the International Development Association. Eligibility for IDA support depends first and foremost on a countrys relative poverty, defined as GNI per capita below an established threshold and updated annually ($1,175 in fiscal year 2020).
short_def: This indicator measures whether the country is eligible for borrowing from the International Development Association.
dissem_agency: International Development Association World Bank Group
methodo: Score is 1 if country is eligible for borrowing from IDA.

name: Reports on the Observance of Standards and Codes (ROSCs)
family: Quality assurance and codes of conduct
definition: Amount of IMF reports on the observance of standards and codes (ROCs). ROSCs summarize the extent to which countries observe certain internationally recognized standards and codes.
short_def: Amount of IMF reports on the observance of standards and codes (ROCs).
methodo: Quantity of IMF reports on the observance of standards and codes (ROCs).  Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Import and export price indexes
source: IMF: International Financial Statistics (IFS). Series 74, 75, or/and 76.
definition: Existence of import and export price indexes, according to international standards. Import and export price indexes measure changes in the price of goods and services in international trade. They are used to deflate the value of imports and exports. Import price index is also used as an indicator of future domestic inflation.
short_def: Import and export price indexes measure changes in the price of goods and services in international trade. They are used to deflate the value of imports and exports.
methodo: Score is 1 if the index is available monthly or quarterly. For assessment it will be looked back 8 years starting 3 years before current year.

name: Least developed country (LDC)
source: United Nations Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States
definition: This indicator captures whether the country is a least developed country, defined by UNSD.
short_def: This indicator captures whether the country is a least developed country, defined by UNSD.
dissem_agency: United Nations Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States
methodo: Score is 1 if country is a least developed country.

name: Income poverty
source: World Bank, Development Research Group, PovacalNet
definition: Existence of data on income poverty, according to international standards. Proportion of population below US$1.25 a day is the percentage of the population living on less than $1.25 a day at 2005 international prices. The US$1.25 poverty line is compared to consumption or income per person and includes consumption from own production and income in kind. This poverty line has fixed purchasing power across countries. This indicator measures progress toward the reduction of extreme poverty and relates to the first MDG goal to eradicate extreme poverty and hunger.
short_def: Proportion of population below US$1.25 a day is the percentage of the population living on less than $1.25 a day at 2005 international prices.
methodo: Scores are 1, 2/3, and 1/3 if the indicator was observed at least 3 times, 2 times, or once within 10 years. For assessment, look at 10-year interval starting two years before current and count number of data points available.

name: Industrial production index
definition: Existence of data for an industrial price index, according to international standards. Industrial production index measures changes in industrial production and is widely used for the observation and analysis of the current economic activity. Monthly survey on industrial production of index allows identifying the turning points in economic development at an early stage.
short_def: Industrial production index measures changes in industrial production and is widely used for the observation and analysis of the current economic activity.
methodo: Score is 1 if the index is available monthly or quarterly. For assessment it will be looked back 8 years starting 3 years before current year.

name: Statistical society presence
definition: This indicator captures whether the International Statistical Institute (ISI) recognizes a non-governmental statistical body in the country, as indicated as national or regional statistical society on the ISI website. The ISI is a non-profit, non-government organization and has had consultative status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations since 1949.
short_def: This indicator captures whether the International Statistical Institute (ISI) recognizes a non-governmental statistical body in the country, as indicated as national or regional statistical society on the ISI website.
methodo: Score is 1 if the International Statistical Institute (ISI) recognizes a non-governmental statistical body in the country.

name: Landlocked developing state
source: United Nations Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States
definition: This indicator captures whether the country is a landlocked developing state, defined by UNSD.
short_def: This indicator captures whether the country is a landlocked developing state, defined by UNSD.
dissem_agency: United Nations Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States
methodo: Score is 1 if country is a landlocked developing state.

name: Language accessibility
definition: This indicator measures whether the NSO webpage provides information in another language in addition to the national one, where the second language can be English, French or Spanish. This indicator measures the language accessibility of the NSOs webpage. A country whose national language is either English, Spanish or French and which provides information only in such language is considered language accessible.
short_def: This indicator measures whether the NSO webpage has a language-accessible portal, providing information at least in another language in addition to the national one.
methodo: Score is 1 if the NSOwebpage has an interface in anotherlanguagein addition to the national one.

name: Data on maternal health
source: UNICEF: State of the World's Children.
definition: Existence of data on maternal health, according to international standards. Births attended by skilled health staff are the percentage of deliveries attended by personnel trained to give the necessary supervision, care, and advice to women during pregnancy, labor, and the postpartum period, to conduct deliveries on their own, and to care for the newborns. High maternal mortality rates in many countries are the result of inadequate reproductive health care for women and inadequately spaced births. The indicator monitors the ability of the health system to provide good antenatal and postnatal care for women and relates to the fifth MDG aiming at improving maternal health, with a target of reducing by three-quarters, between 1990 and 2015, the maternal mortality ratio.
short_def: Births attended by skilled health staff are the percentage of deliveries attended by personnel trained to give the necessary supervision, care, and advice to women during pregnancy, labor, and the postpartum period, to conduct deliveries on their own, and to care for the newborns.
methodo: Scores are 1, 2/3, and 1/3 if the indicator was observed at least 3 times, 2 times, or once within 10 years. For assessment, look at 10-year interval starting two years before current and count number of data points available.

name: Metadata available on website
definition: The availability of metadata on the National Statistical Organization website.

name: Methodology assessment of statistical capacity (index 0 - 100)
family: Quality assurance and codes of conduct
definition: Quality of methodology (composite of indicators).
short_def: Quality of methodology (composite of indicators).
methodo: Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: NADA (National Data Archive) use
definition: This indicator captures whether the National Data Archive (NADA) statistical tool is used for microdata cataloging. NADA is an open source microdata cataloging system, developed by the World Bank Group. It is compliant with the Data Documentation Initiative (DDI) and Dublin Cores RDF metadata standards. It serves as a portal for researchers to browse, search, compare, apply for access, and download relevant census or survey datasets, questionnaires, reports and other information. The indicator thus provides a benchmark for systematic access to microdata.
short_def: This indicator captures whether the National Data Archive (NADA) statistical tool is used for microdata cataloging.
methodo: Score is 1 if the National Data Archive (NADA) statistical tool is used for microdata cataloging.

name: National accounts base year
source: World Bank: World Development Indicator (Primary Data Documentation)
definition: Quality of national accounts, according to international standards. National accounts base year is the year used as the base period for constant price calculations in the country's national accounts. It is recommended that he base year of constant price estimates be changed periodically to reflect changes in economic structure and relative prices.
short_def: National accounts base year is the year used as the base period for constant price calculations in the country's national accounts.
methodo: Score is 1 if annual chain linking has been adopted or the base year is within the last 10 years. For assessment it will be looked back 10 years starting the year before current.

name: Data portal
definition: This indicator measures whether the country provides access to national database or national data portal. Data portal is defined by the UNSD as a generic, stand-alone web-based, interactive data and metadata platform with database modelled for specific data types and domains such as microdata, aggregate data or geospatial data.
short_def: This indicator measures whether the country provides access to national database or national data portal.
methodo: Score is 1 if the country provides access to national database or national data portal.

name: National immunization coverage
definition: Existence of data on national imunization coverage, according to international standards. WHO and UNICEF collect and review data available on national immunization coverage. Then estimates on the level of immunization coverage are made by using officially reported data, survey results, scientific literature, and by taking account of potential biases and consultation with local experts. The gap between the international estimates and the government official estimates therefore suggests that the estimation method adopted by the country differs from the internationally recommended practice.
short_def: WHO and UNICEF collect and review data available on national immunization coverage. Then estimates on the level of immunization coverage are made by using officially reported data, survey results, scientific literature, and by taking account of potential biases and consultation with local experts. The gap between the international estimates and the government official estimates therefore suggests that the estimation method adopted by the country differs from the internationally recommended practice.
methodo: Score is 1 if the government official estimate on measles vaccine coverage is consistent with the WHO/UNICEF estimate. For assessment it will be looked at the 4 most recent years with data available. The average of WHO/UNICEF estimate and government (official) data needs to be <=1 in order to get score.

name: National Strategy for Development of Statistics (NSDS) existence
definition: This indicator measures whether there currently exists a National Strategy for Development of Statistics (NSDS) in the country. Existence of a NSDS is defined as whether the country is in the process of designing or adopting an NSDS or if the country is implementing an NSDS.
short_def: This indicator measures whether there currently exists a National Strategy for Development of Statistics (NSDS) in the country.
methodo: Score is 1 if there currently exists in the country a National Strategy for Development of Statistics (NSDS).

name: Data portal
definition: Existence of national data base, whether or not maintained by the country

name: National statistical council
definition: This indicator measures whether there exists an agency/board/institution that advises the Chief Statistician on National Statistical Organization activities, primarily on program priorities. The name varies across countries: National Statistical Board, National Statistical Commission, National Statistical Committee.
short_def: This indicator measures whether there exists an agency/board/institution that advises the Chief Statistician on National Statistical Organization activities.
methodo: Score is 1 if the indicator measures whether there exists an agency/board/institution that advises the Chief Statistician on National Statistical Organization activities.

name: National support to statistics > 50%
definition: Whether the share of national statistical budget dedicated to statistics exceeds 50 percent

name: Newsletter
note: is this useful? Can it be folded into some other indicator about dissemination?

methodo: Score is the weighted sum of the scores in each of the five elements that compose data coverage in each of the three data categories (social, economic and environmental statistics). Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.  Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Open Government membership
note: different values in metabase vs. prioritization tool
definition: This indicator captures whether the country participates in the Open Government Partnership (OGP). OGP aims to support governments in becoming sustainably more transparent, more accountable, and more responsive to their own citizens, with the ultimate goal of improving the quality of governance, as well as the quality of services that citizens receive. The indicator is thus a benchmark for the transparency, openness and accountability of governments.

methodo: Score is 1 if country participates in the OGP.

name: Per capita GDP growth
source: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files
definition: Existence of data on per capita GDP growth, according to international standards. GDP per capita is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output, divided by mid-year population. Growth is calculated from constant price GDP data in local currency. Sustained economic growth increases average incomes and is strongly linked to poverty reduction. GDP per capita provides a basic measure of the value of output per person, which is an indirect indicator of per capita income. Growth in GDP and GDP per capita are considered broad measures of economic growth.
short_def: GDP per capita is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output, divided by mid-year population.
methodo: Scores are 1, 2/3, and 1/3 if this indicator is either observed annually, at least 6 times, or once within the 10-year reference period, respectively. For assessment look at 10-year interval starting the year before current.

name: Population
source: (1) United Nations Population Division. World Population Prospects: 2019 Revision. (2) Census reports and other statistical publications from national statistical offices, (3) Eurostat: Demographic Statistics, (4) United Nations Statistical Division. Population and Vital Statistics Reprot (various years), (5) U.S. Census Bureau: International Database, and (6) Secretariat of the Pacific Community: Statistics and Demography Programme.
definition: Total population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship. The values shown are midyear estimates.
short_def: Total number of people living in the country.
methodo: Population estimates are usually based on national population censuses. Estimates for the years before and after the census are interpolations or extrapolations based on demographic models. Errors and undercounting occur even in high-income countries. In developing countries errors may be substantial because of limits in the transport, communications, and other resources required to conduct and analyze a full census. For more information, see the World Bank metadata for Population, total.  Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Population census
source: United Nations Statistical Division (UNSD), 2010 World Population and Housing Censuses Programme
definition: This indicator measures whether there exists a population census according to international standards. Population censuses collect data on the size, distribution and composition of population and information on a broad range of social and economic characteristics of the population. It also provides sampling frames for household and other surveys. It is recommended that population censuses be conducted at least every 10 years.
short_def: Population censuses collect data on the size, distribution and composition of population and information on a broad range of social and economic characteristics of the population.
methodo: Score is 1 if the country had a census at least once in the last 10 years. For assessment it will be looked at 10 year interval starting the year before current and counting the number of agricultural censuses conducted.

name: Poverty surveys
definition: This indicator measures whether there exists a povery surveys according to international standards. Poverty surveys collect data on household income, consumption and expenditure, including income in kind. They typically include income, expenditure, and consumption surveys, household budget surveys, Integrated Surveys, Living Standard Measuring Surveys, and other poverty related surveys. It is recommended that poverty surveys be conducted at least every 3 to 5 years.
short_def: Poverty surveys collect data on household income, consumption and expenditure, including income in kind. They typically include income, expenditure, and consumption surveys, household budget surveys, Integrated Surveys, Living Standard Measuring Surveys, and other poverty related surveys. It is recommended that poverty surveys be conducted at least every 3 to 5 years.
methodo: Scores are 1, and 1/2 if a survey is conducted at least 3 times, or 2 times respectively in the last 10 years. For assessment it will be looked at 10-year interval starting the year before current and the number of conducted poverty surveys counted.

name: Press releases issued at least quarterly
definition: This indicator measures whether official statements on statistical indicators are issued to journalists at least on a quarterly basis. Timeliness and frequency of official statements  in conjunction with statistical accuracy - can help improving forecasts and support policymakers to take relevant decisions detecting changes in the economy in advance.
short_def: This indicator measures whether official statements on statistical indicators are issued to journalists at least on a quarterly basis.
methodo: Score is 1 if official statements are released on a quarterly basis or more frequently.

name: Data on primary education completion
source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics: Table 12: Measures of progression and completion in primary education (ISCED 1).
definition: Existence of data on primary education completion, according to international standards. Primary completion rate (PCR) is the number of students successfully completing the last year of (or graduating from) primary school in a given year, divided by the number of children of official graduation age in the population. Because of difficulties with developing data based on this definition, data analysis is generally based on the PCR proxy indicator which is the number of children reaching the last year of primary school (as defined by a country) net of repeaters. The indicator, which monitors education system coverage and student progression, is intended to measure human capital formation and school system quality and efficiency and relates to the second MDG to achieve universal primary education.
short_def: Primary completion rate (PCR) is the number of students successfully completing the last year of (or graduating from) primary school in a given year, divided by the number of children of official graduation age in the population.E100
methodo: Scores are 1, 2/3, and 1/3 if the indicator is observed for 5, 4-3, and 2-1 out of the 5 latest years, respectively. For assessment, look at 5-year interval starting 2 years before current and count number of data points available.

methodo: Estimate gives the country's score on the aggregate indicator, in units of a standard normal distribution, i.e. ranging from approximately -2.5 to 2.5.
methodo_link: Statistical Methodology available in Kaufmann, Daniel, Aart Kraay and Massimo Mastruzzi (2010). \The Worldwide Governance Indicators: Methodology and Analytical Issues\". World Bank Policy Research Working Paper No. 5430 (http://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=1682130). "

name: SDDS subscription
family: Quality assurance and codes of conduct
definition: This indicator captures whether the country has subscribed to SDDS. The SDDS is a global benchmark for disseminating macroeconomic statistics to the public.  Countries that subscribe to the SDDS agree to follow good practices in four areas: the coverage, periodicity, and timeliness of data: public access to those data: data integrity: and data quality. The indicator thus provides a proxy for quality of statistical data.
short_def: This indicator captures whether the country has subscribed to SDDS.
methodo: Score is 1 if country has subscribed to SDDS.

methodo: Score ranges from 0 to 1. It represents the share of the total foreign support to statistics received by the country which is devoted to environmental and multi-sectoral statistics.

name: Share of foreign support dedicated to general data collection, preservation and dissemination (ten years)

Subcategories of general data collection, processing, dissemination and analysis include: Metadata: Classifications: Data sources (Population and housing censuses: registers of population, dwellings and buildings, Agricultural censuses, registers and surveys, Household surveys, Business registers and surveys, Other administrative and non_survey sources, Data editing and data linkage) Data warehousing, output databases, web sites and other use of ICT: Dissemination, marketing and promotion of statistical literacy: Statistical confidentiality and disclosure protection: Data analysis.
short_def: This indicator shows the share of foreign support to statistics dedicated to general data collection, preservation and dissemination received in past ten years.
methodo: Score ranges from 0 to 1. It represents the share of the total foreign support to statistics received by the country which is devoted to general statistical items and methodology of data collection, processing, dissemination and analysis.

name: Special Data Dissemination Standard
definition: Use of the Special Data Dissemination Standard. The Special Data Dissemination Standard (SDDS) was established by the IMF for member countries that have or that might seek access to international capital markets, to guide them in providing their economic and financial data to the public. Although subscription is voluntary, the subscribing member needs to be committed to observing the standard and provide information about its data and data dissemination practices (metadata). The metadata are posted on the IMF's Dissemination Standards Bulletin Board. The SDDS is expected to enhance the availability of timely and comprehensive data and improve the functioning of financial markets.
short_def: Use of the Special Data Dissemination Standard. The Special Data Dissemination Standard (SDDS) was established by the IMF for member countries to guide them in providing their economic and financial data to the public.
methodo: Score is 1 for subscribing countries: 0 otherwise.

methodo: The Statistical Capacity Indicator score is calculated as the average of the scores of the 3 dimensions, i.e. Availability, Collection, Practice.

name: Statistical Literacy Indicator
definition: The overall score of the statistical literacy indicator.

name: Statistical Literacy Indicator (level 1)
definition: This indicator shows the score of level 1 sub-index of the statistical literacy indicator: consistent, non-critical use of statistics. The score is determined by using text mining techniques to measure literacy and critical thinking in the respective country based on articles from RSS feeds of national newspapers.
short_def: This indicator measures the level of statistical literacy in the country. This score measures the first level of statistical literacy: consistent, non-critical use of statistics.
methodo: Score ranges from 0 to 100. It represents the percentage of articles that contain at least one search term from the predefined keyword lists, indicating data sources, a statistical indicator and a list from statistical capacity building projects.

name: Statistical Literacy Indicator (level 2)
definition: This indicator shows the score of level 2 sub-index of the statistical literacy indicator: critical use of statistics. The score is determined by using text mining techniques to measure literacy and critical thinking in the respective country based on articles from RSS feeds of national newspapers.
short_def: This indicator measures the level of statistical literacy in the country. This score measures the first level of statistical literacy: critical use of statistics.
methodo: Score ranges from 0 to 100. It represents the percentage of articles that contain at least one search term from the predefined keyword list of adjectives to assess the quality of research studies.

name: Statistical Literacy Indicator (level 3)

The score is determined by using text mining techniques to measure literacy and critical thinking  in the respective country based on articles from RSS feeds of national newspapers.
short_def: This indicator measures the level of statistical literacy in the country. This score measures the first level of statistical literacy: critical mathematical use of statistics.
methodo: Score ranges from 0 to 100. It represents the percentage of articles that contain at least one search term from the predefined keyword list of statistical fallacies.

name: Use of statistics index
note: better for 2018 from PRESS than 2017 from metabase?
definition: This indicator assesses the systematic use of statistical knowledge with statistical terms and indicators in national policy documents  (National Development Plan and Poverty Reducation Strategy Papers) through text mining techniques. It is a composite indicator consisting of 4 sub-indices that aim to reflect the relevance of statistical evidence. It comprises four main dimensions: i) Basic consideration (Level 1): ii) Diagnosis and quantification (Level 2): iii) Statistical Analysis (Level 3): iv) Disaggregation.
short_def: This indicator assesses the systematic use of statistical knowledge with statistical terms and indicators in national policy documents. It is a composite indicator consisting of 4 sub-indices that aim to reflect the relevance of statistical evidence. It comprises four main dimensions: i) Basic consideration: ii) Diagnosis and quantification: iii) Statistical Analysis: iv) Disaggregation.
methodo: Score ranges from 0 to 100. The score is the weighted sum of each of the four components' scores, whose relative weight is reported in brackets: i) Basic Consideration (25%): ii) Diagnosis and quantification (24%): iii) Statistical Analysis (22%): iv) Disaggregation (29%).

methodo: Score is 1 if the country is judged to have complete registries of vital (birth and death) statistics within the last 15 years by the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Information and Policy Analysis, Statistics Division.

family: Quality assurance and codes of conduct
definition: This indicator measures whether the national statistical legislation complies with United Nations Fundamental Principles of Statistics - UN FPOS (SDG 17.18.2). A country has a statistical legislation that respects the principles of and is compliant with the UN FPOS if the statistics law has provisions relating to all ten Principles.
short_def: This indicator measures whether the national statistical legislation complies with United Nations Fundamental Principles of Statistics (SDG 17.18.2)
methodo: Scores is 1 if the country has a national statistical legislation compliant with United Nations Fundamental Principles of Statistics.

name: Statistical plan implemented
definition: This indicator measures whether there is a national statistical plan under implementation. It relates to SDG 17.18.3 and is based on the annual Status Report on National Strategies for the Development of Statistics (NSDS). The indicator shows the countries that are either (i) implementing a strategy, (ii) designing one or (iii) awaiting adoption of the strategy in the current year.
short_def: This indicator measures whether there is a national statistical plan under implementation (SDG 17.18.3)
methodo: Score is 1 if the country is implementing a national statistical plan, designing one or awaiting adoption of the strategy in the  year.
