tag: Whether the national statistical plan under implementation is fully funded (SDG 17.18.3)
timeseries: This indicator measures whether the national statistical plan under implementation is fully funded (SDG 17.18.3)

name: Statistical plan fully funded
definition: This indicator measures whether the national statistical plan under implementation is fully funded. It relates to SDG 17.18.3 and is based on the annual Status Report on National Strategies for the Development of Statistics (NSDS).
short_def: This indicator measures whether the national statistical plan under implementation is fully funded.
methodo: Score is 1 if the country has a fully funded national statistical plan.

name: Microdata datasets online (quantity)
definition: This indicator measures the number of datasets that are available through the World Bank microdata cataloging tool. The Microdata library operates as a data portal: it comprises datasets produced by the World Bank and from other international organizations, statistical agencies and other agencies in low and middle-income countries. Microdata are unit-level data collected through sample surveys of households, censuses, and administrative systems._Datasets might also come from agricultural, population or housing censuses or through administrative data collection processes.
short_def: This indicator measures the number of datasets available through the World Bank microdata cataloging tool.
methodo: Quantity of datasets available on the World Bank microdata cataloging tool by country. Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Microdata dataset citations (quantity)
definition: This indicator measures the of citations in peer-reviewed international journals, from the datasets available through the World Bank microdata cataloging tool. The use of the datasets taken from the World Bank microdata cataloging tool must always be acknowledged using citations, comprising the primary investigator, the title of the survey including country, acronym and year of implementation, the survey reference number, the source and date of download. The amount of citations in journals from datasets proxies the quality of the data and their compatibility to conduct research using them.
short_def: This indicator measures the of citations in peer-reviewed international journals, from the datasets available through the World Bank microdata cataloging tool.
methodo: Quantity of citations in peer-reviewed international journals, from datasets available on the World Bank microdata cataloging tool. Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Microdata average citations per dataset
definition: This indicator measures the unweighted average number of citations in peer-reviewed international journals, per dataset, from the datasets available through the World Bank microdata cataloging tool.
short_def: This indicator measures the average number of citations in peer-reviewed international journals, per dataset, from the datasets are available through the World Bank microdata cataloging tool.
methodo: Unweighted average of citations in peer-reviewed international journals per dataset available on the World Bank microdata cataloging tool. Figures are the result of the ratio of the indicator Microdata dataset citations (quantity) over the indicator Microdata datasets online (quantity). Categories are partitioned by quintile.

name: Tenure of NSO head
definition: The ratio of the number of years in power of the current head of the National Statistical Organization, against the current head of state.
tag: ratio of years in office (NSO state : head of state)

name: SDG portal
definition: This indicator measures whether it exists an official country-operated, dedicated online portal for reporting SDG progress, detailed either on the government webpage or NSO website. SDGs require an increasing frequency in reporting and a greater level of disaggregation of data. The reporting of SDG information is a signal for the importance of data portals attributed by the countries.
short_def: This indicator measures whether it exists an official country-operated, dedicated online portal for reporting SDG progress, detailed either in the government webpage or NSO website.
methodo: Score is 1 if it exists an official country-operated, dedicated online portal for reporting SDG progress.

name: Appendices online
family: Quality assurance and codes of conduct
definition: Whether explanatory material accompanies online published data (e.g., erratum, methodology, metadata, guides, manuals)

name: Metadata published
definition: More than 50% of data published includes metadata

name: International data dissemination
definition: This indicator measures whether the country uses at least one international data platform to disseminate statistical data among African Information Highway, ArcGIS, CountryStat, DevInfo, Eurostat, IMIS, NADA, OECDStat, US/UK open source SDGs National Reporting Platform,  Prognoz (Open Data Portal) & Knoema, Custom-developed data platform.
short_def: This indicator measures whether the country uses at least one international data platform.
methodo: Score is 1 if the country uses an international data dissemination platform.

name: International statistical quality management framework
family: Quality assurance and codes of conduct
definition: This indicator measures whether the country follows at least one international quality management framework (GDDS, DQAF, European Statistical System Quality Assurance Framework, Total Quality Management, ISO EN 9001).
short_def: This indicator measures whether the country follows at least one international quality management framework.
methodo: Score is 1 if the country follows at least one international quality management framework. Data come from the internal PARIS21 UNFPOS survey.

name: Regulations available online
definition: Whether the National Statistical Organization regulations are published online

name: SDMX
definition: Use of the Statistical Data and Metadata eXchange (SDMX), in at least some statistical domains or for at least some datasets

name: Income group
definition: World Bank Country and Lending Groups. Low-income economies are defined as those with a GNI per capita, calculated using the World Bank Atlas method, of $1,025 or less in 2018: lower middle-income economies are those with a GNI per capita between $1,026 and $3,995: upper middle-income economies are those with a GNI per capita between $3,996 and $12,375: high-income economies are those with a GNI per capita of $12,376 or more.
short_def: Partitioning of the countries into four income groups according to WB Country and Lending Groups: High, Upper Middle, Lower Middle and Low Income using GNI per capita data.
methodo: The Gross National Income is computed using the World Bank Atlas method.

name: Control of corruption
note: Clearer interpretation than std normal estimates
source: WGI are produced by Daniel Kaufmann (Natural Resource Governance Institute and Brookings Institution) and Aart Kraay (World Bank Development Research Group).
definition: Control of Corruption captures perceptions of the extent to which public power is exercised for private gain, including both petty and grand forms of corruption, as well as \capture\" of the state by elites and private interests."
short_def: World Bank Governance Indicator on Corruption. Control of Corruption captures perceptions of the extent to which public power is exercised for private gain, including both petty and grand forms of corruption, as well as \capture\" of the state by elites and private interests. "
methodo: Percentile rank indicates the country's rank among all countries covered by the aggregate indicator, with 0 corresponding to lowest rank, and 100 to highest rank. Percentile ranks have been adjusted to correct for changes over time in the composition of the countries covered by the WGI.

name: Government effectiveness
note: Clearer interpretation than std normal estimates
source: WGI are produced by Daniel Kaufmann (Natural Resource Governance Institute and Brookings Institution) and Aart Kraay (World Bank Development Research Group).
definition: Government Effectiveness captures perceptions of the quality of public services, the quality of the civil service and the degree of its independence from political pressures, the quality of policy formulation and implementation, and the credibility of the government's commitment to such policies.
short_def: World Bank Governance Indicator on Government Effectiveness. Government Effectiveness captures perceptions of the quality of public services, the quality of the civil service and the degree of its independence from political pressures, the quality of policy formulation and implementation, and the credibility of the government's commitment to such policies.
methodo: Percentile rank indicates the country's rank among all countries covered by the aggregate indicator, with 0 corresponding to lowest rank, and 100 to highest rank. Percentile ranks have been adjusted to correct for changes over time in the composition of the countries covered by the WGI.

name: Regulatory quality
note: Clearer interpretation than std normal estimates
source: WGI are produced by Daniel Kaufmann (Natural Resource Governance Institute and Brookings Institution) and Aart Kraay (World Bank Development Research Group).
definition: Regulatory Quality captures perceptions of the ability of the government to formulate and implement sound policies and regulations that permit and promote private sector development.
short_def: World Bank Governance Indicator on Regulatory Quality. Regulatory Quality captures perceptions of the ability of the government to formulate and implement sound policies and regulations that permit and promote private sector development.
methodo: Percentile rank indicates the country's rank among all countries covered by the aggregate indicator, with 0 corresponding to lowest rank, and 100 to highest rank. Percentile ranks have been adjusted to correct for changes over time in the composition of the countries covered by the WGI.

name: Rule of law
note: Clearer interpretation than std normal estimates
source: WGI are produced by Daniel Kaufmann (Natural Resource Governance Institute and Brookings Institution) and Aart Kraay (World Bank Development Research Group).
definition: Rule of Law captures perceptions of the extent to which agents have confidence in and abide by the rules of society, and in particular the quality of contract enforcement, property rights, the police, and the courts, as well as the likelihood of crime and violence.
short_def: World Bank Governance Indicator on Rule of Law. Rule of Law captures perceptions of the extent to which agents have confidence in and abide by the rules of society, and in particular the quality of contract enforcement, property rights, the police, and the courts, as well as the likelihood of crime and violence.
methodo: Percentile rank indicates the country's rank among all countries covered by the aggregate indicator, with 0 corresponding to lowest rank, and 100 to highest rank. Percentile ranks have been adjusted to correct for changes over time in the composition of the countries covered by the WGI.

name: Indicator coverage and disaggregation
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures the extent to which representative indicators within each data category are disaggregated categorically and geographically.
short_def: Coverage Element 1 for ODIN data coverage score. It measures the extent to which representative indicators within each data category are disaggregated categorically and geographically.
methodo: Score is 1 if all representative indicators within each data category are disaggregated categorically and geographically. Score is 1/2 if at least a data category has at least one indicator with one disaggregation. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: Data Available for the Last 5 Years
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether data are available in a data category over the last five years. Scores for this element cannot be greater than the score for coverage element 1. Scores are given by data category, not indicator. For the categories National Accounts, Price Indexes, and International Trade, if data are presented on a quarterly basis, 3 out of 4 quarters for a particular year must be available to award credit. If data are presented on a monthly basis, 7 out of 12 months for a particular year must be present to award credit.
short_def: Coverage Element 2 for ODIN data coverage score. It measures whether data are available in a data category over the last five years.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data are available for 3 of the last 5 years and if some published data are available for 1-2 of the last 5 years, respectively. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: Data Available for the Last 10 Years
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether data are available in a data category over the last ten years. Scores for this element cannot be greater than the score for coverage element 1. Scores are given by data category, not indicator. For the categories National Accounts, Price Indexes, and International Trade, if data are presented on a quarterly basis, 3 out of 4 quarters for a particular year must be available to award credit. If data are presented on a monthly basis, 7 out of 12 months for a particular year must be present to award credit.
short_def: Coverage Element 3 for ODIN data coverage score. It measures whether data are available in a data category over the last ten years.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data are available for 6 of the last 10 years and if some published data are available for 3-5 of the last 5 years, respectively. Score is 0 if all published data are unavailable for 2 or fewer of the last 10 years. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: First Administrative Level
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether data are available at the first administrative level. Additionally, data disaggregated at the first administrative level is only scored if national level data also exists for that indicator. Often, national data are included in the same file as subnational data as an aggregate figure. To identify the first administrative levels, ODIN largely draws on the ISO 3166-2 standard. In many countries, first administrative levels refer to governorates, regions, or provinces.
short_def: Coverage Element 4 for ODIN data coverage score. It measures whether data are available at the first administrative level.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data in a data category are available at first administrative level and if some published data in a data category are available at first administrative level, respectively. Score is 0 if no data are available at this level. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: Second Administrative Level
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether data are available at the second administrative level. Scores for this element cannot be greater than the score for coverage element 1. Additionally, data disaggregated at the second administrative level are only scored if national level data also exists for that indicator. Often, national data are included in the same file as subnational data as aggregate figures. No official list exists for the second administrative level classifications. If geographical disaggregation exists that does not qualify as first administrative level, assume that the data are disaggregated to the second administrative level as long as the classification appears to be a further division of the first administrative level. It is possible to score points on this element even if no data are disaggregated at the first administrative level.
short_def: Coverage Element 5 for ODIN data coverage score. It measures whether data are available at the second administrative level.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data in a data category are available at second administrative level and if some published data in a data category are available at second administrative level, respectively. Score is 0 if no data are available at this level. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: Machine Readability
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether data are available in a machine-readable format such as XLS, XLSX, CSV, and JSON. Machine-readable file formats allow users to easily process data using a computer. When data are made available in formats that are not machine readable, users cannot easily access and modify the data, which severely restricts the scope of the datas use.
short_def: Openness Element 1 for ODIN data openness score. It measures whether data are available in a machine readable format such as XLS, XLSX, CSV, and JSON.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data are available in a machine-readable format (such as XLS, XLSX, CSV, Stata, SAS, SPSS, JSON and so forth) and if some published data are available in machine-readable format, respectively. Score is 0 if all published data are not available in machine-readable format. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: Non-proprietary Format
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether data are available in a non-proprietary  format such as XLSX, CSV, DOCX, XML, HTML and JSON. If data files are compressed in RAR format (which is proprietary), data for that indicator should be considered proprietary even if the enclosing files are in a non-proprietary format. Files compressed in ZIP format are not affected.
short_def: Openness Element 2 for ODIN data openness score. It measures whether data are available in a non-proprietary  format such as XLSX, CSV, DOCX, XML, HTML and JSON.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data are available in non-proprietary format (such as XLSX, DOCX, CSV, XML, HTML, and JSON) and if some published data are available in non-proprietary format, respectively. Score is 0 if no data are available in non-proprietary format. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: Download Options
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether data are available with three different download options: bulk download, API, and user-select options. A bulk download is defined at the indicator level as: The ability to download all data recorded in ODIN for a particular indicator (all years, disaggregations, and subnational data) in one file, or multiple files that can be downloaded simultaneously. Bulk downloads are a key component of the Open Definition, which requires data to be provided as a whole . . . and downloadable via the internet. User-selectable download options are defined as: Users must be able to select an indicator and at least one other dimension to create a download or table. These dimensions could include time periods, geographic disaggregations, or other recommended disaggregations.
short_def: Openness Element 3 for ODIN data openness score. It measures whether data are available with three different download options: bulk download, API, and user-select options.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data has a bulk download option and an API or user-selectable download option and if some published data has an API, bulk download, or user-selectable download options, respectively. Score is 0 if no published data have any download options. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: Metadata Availability
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether metadata are made available. Metadata are defined at the indicator level as information about how the data are defined/calculated and collected. ODIN classifies metadata into three categories: (1) Not Available, (2) Incomplete, and (3) Complete. The following must be available to classify metadata as complete: i) Definition of the indicator, or definition of key terms used in the indicator description, or how the indicator was calculated. ii)Publication (date of upload), compilation date, or date dataset was last updated. iii) Name of data source (what agency collected the data). If the metadata only have one or two of the above elements, they are scored as incomplete.
short_def: Openness Element 4 for ODIN data openness score. It measures whether metadata are made available.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data have complete metadata and if some published data have complete or incomplete metadata, or all published data have incomplete metadata, respectively. Score is 0 if all published data have no metadata. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: Terms of Use (TOU)
source: Open Data Watch - Open Data Inventory
definition: This indicator measures whether data are available with an open terms of use. Generally, terms of use (TOU) will apply to an entire website or data portal. In these cases, all data found on the same website and/or portal will receive the same score. If a portal is located on the same domain as the NSO website, the terms of use on the NSO site will apply. If the data are located on a portal or website on a different domain, another terms of use will need to be present. Terms of use are classified the following ways: (1) Not Available, (2) Restrictive, (3) Semi-Restrictive, and (4) Open.
short_def: Openness Element 5 for ODIN data openness score. It measures whether data are available with an open terms of use.
methodo: Scores are 1 or 1/2 if all published data have a terms of use classified as open and if some published data have a terms of use classified as open, or if some published data has a terms of use classified as semi-restrictive or if all published data has a terms of use classified as semi-restrictive. Score is 0 if no terms of use are found or if all published data have a terms of use classified as restrictive. Overall score is the weighted sum across data categories. Weights are defined for data categories so that each group has equal weight in aggregates computed over all categories, given that the three topical groupings (social, economic, and environmental) contain different numbers of data categories.

name: National Strategy for Development of Statistics (NSDS) Current Status
definition: This indicator assesses the current status of the National Strategy for Development of Statistics (NSDS) in the country. The status can be: implementing: designing or adopting: expired or absent but planning: expired or absent and not planning.
short_def: This indicator assesses the current status of the National Strategy for Development of Statistics (NSDS) in the country.
methodo: Score is 0 if the country's NSDS is expired or absent and is not planned: score is 1 if country has an expired or absent NSDS but is planning it: score is 2 if the country is in the process of designing or adopting an NSDS: score is 3 if the country is implementing an NSDS.

name: Independence of National Statistics Offices (NSO)
definition: This indicator assesses if the independence of the Office of National Statistics is guaranteed, including if it has autonomy to collect data of its choosing, to publish data without prior clearance or approval from any branch of the government, and if its funding is sufficient to collect and publish data of its choosing.
short_def: This indicator assesses if the independence of the Office of National Statistics is guaranteed.
methodo: Score ranges from 0 to 100. A higher score implies a better value. Scoring criteria are provided for 100, 50 and 0. Researchers can also score 75 or 25, if the higher or lower defined criteria dont represent the researchs findings.

name: Share of foreign support dedicated to strategic and managerial issues of official statistics (ten years)
definition: This indicator shows the share of foreign support to statistics dedicated to strategic and managerial issues of official statistics at national and international level received in past ten years. Subcategories of strategic and managerial issues of official statistics include: Institutional frameworks and principles: role of official statistics: statistical law and other legal instruments: statistical programmes, priority setting, relationships with users and respondents (Statistical programmes in the framework of NSDS, all other statistical programmes, priority settings, relationships with users and respondents): quality frameworks and evaluation exercises: human resources and training: technological resources (including standards for electronic data exchange and data sharing): co_ordination of international statistical work.
short_def: This indicator shows the share of foreign support to statistics dedicated to strategic and managerial issues of official statistics at national and international level received in past ten years.
methodo: Score ranges from 0 to 1. It represents the share of the total foreign support to statistics received by the country which is devoted to strategic and managerial issues of official statistics at national and international level.
